name: Bill Yosses' Oven Roasted Peaches with Green Tea Elixir
description: In the introduction to this recipe for Oven Roasted Peaches with Green Tea Elixir from The Perfect Finish Bill Yosses is quick to say that ripe juicy peaches don't really need all that much fussing with to make a truly wonderful summer dessert, and I couldn't agree more. In Yosses' own words he treads lightly with this recipe, adding a chilled, lightly sweetened green tea froth to butter-roasted peaches.

recipeInstructions.text: For the peaches: Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 350°F. Grease a baking sheet with unsalted butter.

Halve the peaches lengthwise and pit them. Don't peel yet. Place the peach halves, cut side up, on the baking sheet. Bake on the center rack until fork tender, about 15 minutes. When cool enough to handle, peel off the skins, and cut into 1-inch cubes.

For the green tea elixir: Place the milk, sugar, and green tea powder in a blender and blend to combine. Add the ice and continue to blend until smooth. Place the chopped peaches in a bowl or goblet. Pour the elixir over them and serve right away.
